description: From Middle English *ripenen (suggested by deverbal ripening (“causing ripeness; ripening”)), equivalent to ripe +‎ -en (verbal suffix).

verbs.description: ripen (third-person singular simple present ripens, present participle ripening, simple past and past participle ripened)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) to grow ripe; to become mature (said of grain, fruit, flowers etc.)
(intransitive) To approach or come to perfection.
(transitive) To cause (something) to mature; to make ripe
examples: The warm sun ripened the corn.

entries.meaning: (transitive) To mature; to fit or prepare; to bring to perfection
